questions.question: How many syllables are in the word "cat"?
questions.explanation: "Cat" has only one sound beat, so it has 1 syllable.

questions.question: Which word has 2 syllables?
questions.explanation: "Apple" has two sound beats: "ap-ple", so it has 2 syllables.

questions.question: How many syllables are in "butterfly"?
questions.explanation: "Butterfly" has three sound beats: "but-ter-fly", so it has 3 syllables.

questions.question: Which word has the most syllables?
questions.explanation: "Rocket" has two syllables (rock-et), while the others have only one.

questions.question: Which word has the least syllables?
questions.explanation: "Tiger" has two syllables (ti-ger), which is fewer than the others. Other words in the options have 3 syllables.

topics.heading: Words with F, FF, and PH

questions.question: Which word is spelled correctly? (Display an image of an elephant)
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is E-L-E-P-H-A-N-T. "Elephant" is spelled with "ph" to make the "f" sound.

questions.question: Which is the correct spelling? (Display an image of a fish)
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is F-I-S-H. "Fish" is spelled with a single "f" at the beginning.

questions.question: Hear the word and choose the correct spelling: /Stuff/
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is S-T-U-F-F. "Stuff" is spelt with a double "ff" at the end.

questions.question: Hear the word and choose the correct spelling: /Photo/
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is P-H-O-T-O. "Photo" is spelled with "ph" to make the "f" sound.

questions.question: See the image and choose the correct spelling: (Display an image of a telephone)
questions.explanation: "Telephone" is spelt with "ph" to make the "f" sound.

questions.question: Which word is spelled correctly? (Display an image of a bell)
questions.explanation: "Bell" is spelled with a double "ll" at the end. There is a short "e" sound, followed by double "L".

questions.question: Hear the word and count the number of letters “L” in that word: /Little/
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is L-I-T-T-L-E. The letter “L” appears two times in this word.

questions.question: Hear the word and choose the correct spelling: /Pill/
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is P-I-L-L. "Pill" is spelled with a double "ll" at the end.

questions.question: Which word has a double "L" in the middle?
questions.explanation: "Yellow" has a double "L" in the middle, while the other words do not have a double "L."

questions.question: Which is the correct spelling (something tiny)?
questions.explanation: The correct spelling is S-M-A-L-L. "Small" is spelled with a double "ll" at the end.

topics.heading: C, Q, K Sound and Spellings

questions.question: Which word is spelled correctly? (Display an image of a cat)
questions.explanation: "Cat" is spelled with a "c" at the beginning. The letter C sounds like /K/ in this word.

questions.question: Which is the correct spelling? (Display an image of a Queen)
questions.explanation: "Queen" is spelt with "qu" at the beginning. It makes the sound of /kw/ in the beginning.

questions.question: Hear the word and choose the correct spelling: /Kite/
questions.explanation: "Kite" is spelled with a "k" at the beginning. It makes the /k/ sound in the beginning.

questions.question: In which word does the letter “C” sound different?
questions.explanation: The word "City" starts with a /ss/ sound in the beginning. Other words start with a /k/ sound in the beginning.

questions.question: Hear the word and choose the correct spelling: /Question/
questions.explanation: "Question" is spelled with 'qu' at the beginning. It makes the sound of /kw/ in the beginning.

questions.question: Which word has the "ai" sound?
questions.explanation: "Rain" uses the "ai" diphthong to make the long "a" sound.

questions.question: How do you spell the word that rhymes with "way"?
questions.explanation: "Day" uses the "ay" diphthong to make the long "a" sound at the end of the word.

questions.question: Which word has the "ay" sound?
questions.explanation: "Play" uses the "ay" diphthong to make the long "a" sound at the end.

questions.question: Hear the word: /Paint/. In this word, where is the "ai"?
questions.explanation: The word is spelt as "Paint". "ai" appears in the middle of "paint."

questions.question: Which word has the "ay" sound at the end?
questions.explanation: "May" uses the "ay" diphthong to make the long "a" sound at the end.

questions.question: Which word has the "ee" sound?
questions.explanation: "Tree" uses the "ee" diphthong to make the long "e" sound.

questions.question: How do you spell the word that means "to look at"?
questions.explanation: "See" uses the "ee" diphthong to make the long "e" sound.

questions.question: Which word has the "ea" sound?
questions.explanation: The spelling is R-E-A-D. "Read" uses the "ea" diphthong to make the long "e" sound.

questions.question: How do you spell the word that means "a big body of water"?
questions.explanation: "Sea" uses the "ea" diphthong to make the long "e" sound.

questions.question: Look at the image and choose which word is spelt correctly. (Display an image of a sheep)
questions.explanation: "Sheep" uses the "ee" diphthong to make the long "e" sound.

questions.question: Which word has the /oy/ sound?
questions.explanation: The word "coin" has the /oy/ sound in it. The word uses the diphthong ‘oi’ in between.

questions.question: What word has the /oy/ sound?
questions.explanation: The word "toy" has the /oy/ sound at the end. The word uses the diphthong ‘oy’ in between.

questions.question: Which word has the /ow/ sound?
questions.explanation: The word "house" has the /ow/ sound in it. It uses the diphthong ‘ou’ in it.

questions.question: Which word uses the diphthong ‘oi’?
questions.explanation: All the given words have the /oy/ in them. These words have the diphthong ‘oi’ in the middle.

questions.question: The diphthong ‘ow’ is used at the _____ of a word or a syllable.
questions.explanation: The diphthong ‘ow’ is used at the end of the word or a syllable. When you hear /ow/ at the end of a word or syllable, use ow (cow, now, pow-er, show-er).

questions.question: Which type of sentence is this? "The cat is sleeping."
questions.explanation: This sentence tells us something. It states a fact, so it's a statement.

questions.question: Which sentence is a question?
questions.explanation: This sentence asks something and ends with a question mark, so it's a question.

questions.question: Which is an exclamation sentence?
questions.explanation: This sentence shows strong feelings and ends with an exclamation mark, so it's an exclamation.

questions.question: What type of sentence is "How old are you?"
questions.explanation: This sentence asks for information and ends with a question mark, so it's a question.

questions.question: Which sentence is a command?
questions.explanation: This sentence tells someone to do something, so it's a command.

questions.question: In "Birds fly high," what is the predicate?
questions.explanation: The predicate tells us something about the subject. Here, it tells us what the birds do.

questions.question: What's the subject in "My friend likes ice cream"?
questions.explanation: The subject is the complete person we're talking about, including 'my.'

questions.question: In "We read books," what's the predicate?
questions.explanation: The predicate tells us what we do. Here, it tells us that we read books.

questions.question: In "She sings beautifully," what is the predicate?
questions.explanation: The predicate includes the action (sings) and how it's done (beautifully).

questions.question: What's the subject in "Big elephants eat leaves"?
questions.explanation: The subject is the complete thing we're talking about, including describing words like 'big.'
